txt.en:
'So, [placeholder]...from what you have told me, it appears that Gwyllion is indeed in league with the traitor Saruman. I expect she is also responsible for the apparitions which have been troubling the Uch-lûth.

'Return tonight, [placeholder], and confront this sorceress. Perhaps with her gone, the Uch-lûth may be able to live without fear.

'Speak with me again when you are ready to leave.'
'I fear the door opened by the Old Woman of the Mountain will be a hard one to close; fortunately, Gwyllion herself shall no longer trouble the Uch-lûth.'
'Good, you have returned. May the Valar guide you, [placeholder].'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>
The Old Woman of the Mountain
You learned that Gwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, is in league with the traitor Saruman. It is likely that she is responsible, as well, for the appearances of evil creatures in the Windfells.
Talk to Saeradan to journey to Gwyllion's hut
Talk to Saeradan at Echad Saeradan
Saeradan is at Echad Saeradan in the Windfells of Enedwaith.\n\nYou should return to Saeradan with news of your victory against Gwyllion.
